refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GValue provides an abstract container structure which can be copied, transformed and compared while holding a value of any (derived) type, which is registered as a GType with a GTypeValueTable in its GTypeInfo structure. Parameter specifications for most value types can be created as GParamSpec derived instances, to implement e.g. GObject properties which operate on GValue containers.
Parameter names need to start with a letter (a-z or A-Z). Subsequent characters can be letters, numbers or a '-'. All other characters are replaced by a '-' during construction.

refsect2.title: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC_BOOLEAN()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GParamSpec is of type G_TYPE_PARAM_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_BOOLEAN()
refsect2.para: Cast a GParamSpec instance into a GParamSpecBoolean.

refsect2.title: G_VALUE_HOLDS_BOOLEAN()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GValue can hold values of type G_TYPE_BOOLEAN.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_boolean ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GParamSpecBoolean instance specifying a G_TYPE_BOOLEAN property. In many cases, it may be more appropriate to use an enum with g_param_spec_enum(), both to improve code clarity by using explicitly named values, and to allow for more values to be added in future without breaking API.
See g_param_spec_internal() for details on property names.

entry.para: canonical name of the property specified
nick name for the property specified
default value for the property specified

refsect2.title: g_value_set_boolean ()
refsect2.para: Set the contents of a G_TYPE_BOOLEAN GValue to v_boolean .

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_BOOLEAN

refsect2.title: g_value_get_boolean ()
refsect2.para: Get the contents of a G_TYPE_BOOLEAN GValue.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_BOOLEAN

refsect2.condition: deprecated:2.32: This function's input type is broken, see g_value_set_schar()
refsect2.title: g_value_set_char ()

warning.para: g_value_set_char has been deprecated since version 2.32 and should not be used in newly-written code.
This function's input type is broken, see g_value_set_schar()

refsect2.para: Set the contents of a G_TYPE_CHAR GValue to v_char .

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_CHAR

refsect2.condition: deprecated:2.32: This function's return type is broken, see g_value_get_schar()
refsect2.title: g_value_get_char ()

warning.para: g_value_get_char has been deprecated since version 2.32 and should not be used in newly-written code.
This function's return type is broken, see g_value_get_schar()

refsect2.para: Do not use this function; it is broken on platforms where the char type is unsigned, such as ARM and PowerPC. See g_value_get_schar().
Get the contents of a G_TYPE_CHAR GValue.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_CHAR

refsect2.title: g_value_get_schar ()
refsect2.para: Get the contents of a G_TYPE_CHAR GValue.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_CHAR

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: signed 8 bit integer contents of value

refsect2.para: Since: 2.32

refsect2.title: g_value_set_schar ()
refsect2.para: Set the contents of a G_TYPE_CHAR GValue to v_char .

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_CHAR
signed 8 bit integer to be set

refsect2.para: Since: 2.32

refsect2.title: g_value_set_static_string ()

duplicated unowned string to be set.

nick name for the property specified

refsect2.title: g_value_set_param ()
refsect2.para: Set the contents of a G_TYPE_PARAM GValue to param .

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_PARAM

refsect2.title: g_value_take_param ()
refsect2.para: Sets the contents of a G_TYPE_PARAM GValue to param and takes over the ownership of the callers reference to param ; the caller doesn't have to unref it any more.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_PARAM

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.para: This is an internal function introduced mainly for C marshallers.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_PARAM

entry.para: a valid GValue whose type is derived from G_TYPE_PARAM

refsect2.title: g_value_dup_param ()

entry.para: a valid GValue whose type is derived from G_TYPE_PARAM

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: GParamSpec content of value , should be unreferenced when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: G_VALUE_HOLDS_POINTER()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GValue can hold values of type G_TYPE_POINTER.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_pointer ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GParamSpecPointer instance specifying a pointer property. Where possible, it is better to use g_param_spec_object() or g_param_spec_boxed() to expose memory management information.
See g_param_spec_internal() for details on property names.

entry.para: canonical name of the property specified
nick name for the property specified

refsect2.title: g_value_set_pointer ()
refsect2.para: Set the contents of a pointer GValue to v_pointer .

refsect2.title: g_value_get_pointer ()
refsect2.para: Get the contents of a pointer GValue.

refsect2.title: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC_OBJECT()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GParamSpec is of type G_TYPE_PARAM_OBJECT.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_OBJECT()
refsect2.para: Casts a GParamSpec instance into a GParamSpecObject.

refsect2.title: G_VALUE_HOLDS_OBJECT()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GValue can hold values derived from type G_TYPE_OBJECT.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_object ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GParamSpecBoxed instance specifying a G_TYPE_OBJECT derived property.
See g_param_spec_internal() for details on property names.

entry.para: canonical name of the property specified
nick name for the property specified
G_TYPE_OBJECT derived type of this property

refsect2.title: g_value_set_object ()
refsect2.para: Set the contents of a G_TYPE_OBJECT derived GValue to v_object .

g_value_set_object() increases the reference count of v_object
(the GValue holds a reference to v_object ). If you do not wish to increase the reference count of the object (i.e. you wish to pass your current reference to the GValue because you no longer need it), use g_value_take_object() instead.
It is important that your GValue holds a reference to v_object (either its own, or one it has taken) to ensure that the object won't be destroyed while the GValue still exists).

entry.para: a valid GValue of G_TYPE_OBJECT derived type

refsect2.title: g_value_take_object ()
refsect2.para:
Sets the contents of a G_TYPE_OBJECT derived GValue to v_object
and takes over the ownership of the callers reference to v_object ; the caller doesn't have to unref it any more (i.e. the reference count of the object is not increased).
If you want the GValue to hold its own reference to v_object , use g_value_set_object() instead.

entry.para: a valid GValue of G_TYPE_OBJECT derived type

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_value_set_object_take_ownership ()

warning.para: g_value_set_object_take_ownership has been deprecated since version 2.4 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: This is an internal function introduced mainly for C marshallers.

entry.para: a valid GValue of G_TYPE_OBJECT derived type

refsect2.title: g_value_get_object ()
refsect2.para: Get the contents of a G_TYPE_OBJECT derived GValue.

entry.para: a valid GValue of G_TYPE_OBJECT derived type

refsect2.title: g_value_dup_object ()
refsect2.para: Get the contents of a G_TYPE_OBJECT derived GValue, increasing its reference count. If the contents of the GValue are NULL, then NULL will be returned.

entry.para: a valid GValue whose type is derived from G_TYPE_OBJECT

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: object content of value , should be unreferenced when no longer needed.

refsect2.title: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC_UNICHAR()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GParamSpec is of type G_TYPE_PARAM_UNICHAR.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_UNICHAR()
refsect2.para: Cast a GParamSpec instance into a GParamSpecUnichar.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_unichar ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GParamSpecUnichar instance specifying a G_TYPE_UINT property. GValue structures for this property can be accessed with g_value_set_uint() and g_value_get_uint().
See g_param_spec_internal() for details on property names.

entry.para: canonical name of the property specified
nick name for the property specified
default value for the property specified

refsect2.title: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC_VALUE_ARRAY()

warning.para: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC_VALUE_ARRAY has been deprecated since version 2.32 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GParamSpec is of type G_TYPE_PARAM_VALUE_ARRAY.

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_VALUE_ARRAY()

warning.para: G_PARAM_SPEC_VALUE_ARRAY has been deprecated since version 2.32 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: Cast a GParamSpec instance into a GParamSpecValueArray.

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_value_array ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GParamSpecValueArray instance specifying a G_TYPE_VALUE_ARRAY property. G_TYPE_VALUE_ARRAY is a G_TYPE_BOXED type, as such, GValue structures for this property can be accessed with g_value_set_boxed() and g_value_get_boxed().
See g_param_spec_internal() for details on property names.

entry.para: canonical name of the property specified
nick name for the property specified
a GParamSpec describing the elements contained in arrays of this property, may be NULL

refsect2.title: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC_OVERRIDE()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GParamSpec is of type G_TYPE_PARAM_OVERRIDE.
Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_OVERRIDE()
refsect2.para: Casts a GParamSpec into a GParamSpecOverride.
Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_override ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new property of type GParamSpecOverride. This is used to direct operations to another paramspec, and will not be directly useful unless you are implementing a new base type similar to GObject.

entry.para: The property that is being overridden

refsect2.para: Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC_GTYPE()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GParamSpec is of type G_TYPE_PARAM_GTYPE.
Since: 2.10

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_GTYPE()
refsect2.para: Casts a GParamSpec into a GParamSpecGType.
Since: 2.10

refsect2.title: G_VALUE_HOLDS_GTYPE()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GValue can hold values of type G_TYPE_GTYPE.
Since: 2.12

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_gtype ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GParamSpecGType instance specifying a G_TYPE_GTYPE property.
See g_param_spec_internal() for details on property names.

entry.para: canonical name of the property specified
nick name for the property specified
a GType whose subtypes are allowed as values of the property (use G_TYPE_NONE for any type)

refsect2.para: Since: 2.10

refsect2.title: g_value_get_gtype ()
refsect2.para: Get the contents of a G_TYPE_GTYPE GValue.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_GTYPE

refsect2.para: Since: 2.12

refsect2.title: g_value_set_gtype ()
refsect2.para: Set the contents of a G_TYPE_GTYPE GValue to v_gtype .

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_GTYPE

refsect2.para: Since: 2.12

refsect2.title: G_IS_PARAM_SPEC_VARIANT()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GParamSpec is of type G_TYPE_PARAM_VARIANT.
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: G_PARAM_SPEC_VARIANT()
refsect2.para: Casts a GParamSpec into a GParamSpecVariant.
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: G_VALUE_HOLDS_VARIANT()
refsect2.para: Checks whether the given GValue can hold values of type G_TYPE_VARIANT.
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_param_spec_variant ()
refsect2.para: Creates a new GParamSpecVariant instance specifying a GVariant property.
If default_value is floating, it is consumed.
See g_param_spec_internal() for details on property names.

entry.para: canonical name of the property specified
nick name for the property specified
a GVariant of type type to use as the default value, or NULL.

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_value_get_variant ()
refsect2.para: Get the contents of a variant GValue.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_VARIANT

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: variant contents of value (may be NULL).

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_value_dup_variant ()
refsect2.para: Get the contents of a variant GValue, increasing its refcount. The returned GVariant is never floating.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_VARIANT

refsect3.title: Returns

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_value_set_variant ()
refsect2.para: Set the contents of a variant GValue to variant . If the variant is floating, it is consumed.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_VARIANT

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: g_value_take_variant ()
refsect2.para: Set the contents of a variant GValue to variant , and takes over the ownership of the caller's reference to variant ; the caller doesn't have to unref it any more (i.e. the reference count of the variant is not increased).
If variant was floating then its floating reference is converted to a hard reference.
If you want the GValue to hold its own reference to variant , use g_value_set_variant() instead.
This is an internal function introduced mainly for C marshallers.

entry.para: a valid GValue of type G_TYPE_VARIANT

refsect2.para: Since: 2.26

maximum value for the property specified

values closer than epsilon will be considered identical by g_param_values_cmp(); the default value is 1e-30.

a string containing the allowed values for the first byte
a string containing the allowed values for the subsequent bytes
the replacement byte for bytes which don't match cset_first or cset_nth .
replace NULL strings by an empty string

warning.para: G_TYPE_PARAM_VALUE_ARRAY has been deprecated since version 2.32 and should not be used in newly-written code.

refsect2.para: The GType of GParamSpecValueArray.

refsect2.title: struct GParamSpecValueArray
refsect2.para: A GParamSpec derived structure that contains the meta data for GValueArray properties.

entry.para: a GParamSpec describing the elements contained in arrays of this property, may be NULL
if greater than 0, arrays of this property will always have this many elements

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_PARAM_OVERRIDE
refsect2.para: The GType of GParamSpecOverride.
Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: struct GParamSpecOverride
refsect2.para: This is a type of GParamSpec type that simply redirects operations to another paramspec. All operations other than getting or setting the value are redirected, including accessing the nick and blurb, validating a value, and so forth. See g_param_spec_get_redirect_target() for retrieving the overidden property. GParamSpecOverride is used in implementing g_object_class_override_property(), and will not be directly useful unless you are implementing a new base type similar to GObject.
Since: 2.4

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_PARAM_GTYPE
refsect2.para: The GType of GParamSpecGType.
Since: 2.10

refsect2.title: struct GParamSpecGType
refsect2.para: A GParamSpec derived structure that contains the meta data for GType properties.

entry.para: a GType whose subtypes can occur as values

refsect2.para: Since: 2.10

refsect2.title: G_TYPE_PARAM_VARIANT
refsect2.para: The GType of GParamSpecVariant.
Since: 2.26

refsect2.title: struct GParamSpecVariant
refsect2.para: A GParamSpec derived structure that contains the meta data for GVariant properties.

When comparing values with g_param_values_cmp(), scalar values with the same type will be compared with g_variant_compare(). Other non-NULL variants will be checked for equality with g_variant_equal(), and their sort order is otherwise undefined. NULL is ordered before non-NULL variants. Two NULL values compare equal.
Since: 2.26
